title.narrative: Strengthening Government of Pakistan's Capacities for Countering Trafficking in Persons and Smuggling of Migrants

description.narrative: The project will be delivered under the overall objective to support efforts of the Government of Pakistan, specifically the Federal Investigation Agency to combat smuggling of migrants (SOM) and trafficking in persons (TiP), by adopting a rights-based and gender-sensitive approach. IOM will support the Government of Pakistan to address the critical gaps highlighted above through four interlinked and mutually reinforcing outcomes relating to prevention and protection, which are critical for coordinated response to combat TiP and SOM. Outcomes relating to prevention will entail strengthening capacities of immigration and border officials to prevent and investigate irregular migration and raising awareness on regular migration pathways and risks of irregular migration amongst local communities. Outcomes relating to protection will include capacity building of the service delivery sector and provision of direct assistance to victims of human trafficking and vulnerable smuggled migrants. The proposed project activities are also closely aligned with the priorities of the FIA, as highlighted through the strategic objectives of their National Action Plan (2021-2025).
